title: Change in NO CO2 equilibrium system

content.question:
<math alttext="N O, gas, plus C O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with N O 2, gas, plus C O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>NO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>CO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
Which of the following changes will increase the amount of <math alttext="N O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in the equilibrium system represented by the equation above?

choices.label: Removing <math alttext="C O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> from the system
Removing <math alttext="C O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> from the system
Increasing the volume of the reaction vessel
Decreasing the volume of the reaction vessel

content.answer: Removing <math alttext="C O, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>CO</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> from the system

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
